H1P and VIOS shutdown / startup procedures for the rack move work scheduled for March 10th

Shutdown process

While others are working (Steps that can go in parallel)

  1. Save current profile for all LPARs assigned to yourself. ( those dynamic lpar'ed but not saved )
  2. Login to pgnmsv01
    1. teprvio10
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -o save -p teprvio10 -n teprvio10 --force
    2. teprvio11
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -o save -p teprvio11 -n teprvio11 --force
    3. teprvio20
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -o save -p teprvio20 -n teprvio20 --force
    4. teprvio21
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -o save -p teprvio21 -n teprvio21 --force
    5. pehrdb99 
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -o save -p pehrdb99  -n pehrdb99  --force
    6. pehrap99 
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -o save -p pehrap99  -n pehrap99  --force
    7. pehrap01 
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -o save -p pehrap01  -n pehrap01  --force
    8. pehrdb98 
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -o save -p pehrdb98  -n pehrdb98  --force
    9. pehrap98 
      sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 mksyscfg -r prof -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -o save -p pehrap98  -n pehrap98  --force
  3. Shutdown pehrap98
    sudo getconsole pehrap98

    Then 

    shutdown -F
  4. Shutdown pehrdb98
    1. Have the DBAs shutdown the database and stop replication
    2. Shutdown
      sudo getconsole pehrdb98

      Then 

      shutdown -F

After all applications and rest of the Unix servers are down

Assumptions

  1. SAP HR Production, QA, Dev, Sandbox, Soln Mgr applications including databases are down.
  2. All non-production lpars and NIM servers are down ( operating system shutdown )

Shutdown H1P systems

  1. Shutdown pehrdb99
    sudo getconsole pehrdb99

    Then 

    shutdown -F
  2. Shutdown pehrap99
    sudo getconsole pehrap99

    Then 

    shutdown -F
  3. Shutdown pehrap01
    sudo getconsole pehrap01

    Then 

    shutdown -F

Shutdown VIOS servers

  1. Shutdown teprvio10
    sudo getconsole teprvio10

    Then 

    shutdown -force
  2. Shutdown teprvio11
    sudo getconsole teprvio11

    Then 

    shutdown -force
  3. Shutdown teprvio20
    sudo getconsole teprvio20

    Then 

    shutdown -force
  4. Shutdown teprvio21
    sudo getconsole teprvio21

    Then 

    shutdown -force

Startup process

Assumptions

  1. All cables have been moved.
  2. HMC access has been restored.

Startup VIOS servers

  1. Login to pgnmsv01
  2. Startup teprvio10
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -n teprvio10 -f teprvio10
  3. Startup teprvio11
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -n teprvio11 -f teprvio11
  4. Startup teprvio20
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -n teprvio20 -f teprvio20
  5. Startup teprvio21
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -n teprvio21 -f teprvio21

Validate VIOS server's SAN connectivity

  1. Login to each VIOS server and execute
    lspath

    Make sure there are no failed paths.

  2. Check if VIOS server's network is healthy.
  3. At this time, it is a go ahead for non-production systems not dependent on NFS mounts.

Startup H1P systems

  1. Login to pgnmsv01
  2. Startup pehrdb99
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -n pehrdb99 -f pehrdb99
  3. Startup pehrap99
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -n pehrap99 -f pehrap99
  4. Startup pehrap01
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8205-E6C-SN101261T -n pehrap01 -f pehrap01
  5. Startup pehrdb98
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -n pehrdb98 -f pehrdb98
  6. Startup pehrap98
    sudo ssh hscroot@tgprhmc3 chsysstate -r lpar -o on -b norm -m Server-8202-E4C-SN101260T -n pehrap98 -f pehrap98

Validate and activate cluster resources for H1P

  1. pehrdb99
    1. Check missing paths
      lsdev -Ccdisk ; lspath
    2. Activate the cluster resource
      sudo /root/cluster/alias99.sh
  2. pehrap99
    1. Check missing paths
      lsdev -Ccdisk ; lspath
    2. Activate the cluster resource
      sudo /root/cluster/mount99.sh
  3. pehrap01
    1. Check missing paths
      lsdev -Ccdisk ; lspath
  4. At this time, H1P can be handed over to SAP Basis to bring up
  5. At this time, it is a go ahead for rest of the non-production systems
  6. pehrdb98
    1. Check missing paths
      lsdev -Ccdisk ; lspath
    2. Handover to DBA to re-establish Dataguard.
  7. pehrap98
    1. Check missing paths
      lsdev -Ccdisk ; lspath
